image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Kentucky; born in White Plains, Westchester County, N.Y., January 7, 1951; graduated from Atherton High School; B.S., University of Louisville, Louisville, Ky., 1974; business executive; sales representative; member of the Kentucky state house of representatives, 1989-1993; special assistant to County Judge/Executive, Jefferson County, Ky., 1985-1989; Peace Corps volunteer (The Gambia, West Africa); business owner; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth Congress (January 3, 1995-January 3, 1997); was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifth Congress.

researchRecord.name: 1994-1995, 7.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The records of Michael Ward document his efforts to prevent the Naval Ordnance Station in Louisville from being closed. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: 1994, 8 commercials on 2 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Michael Ward's 1994 campaign for U.S. Congress in District 3 of Kentucky, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
